skillTree.localised_description: It is common knowledge that Marius relies on the advice of his warhorse, Daisy Kurt von Helboring II, as much as any advisors.

effects.description: Mount: Barded Warhorse

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: "My dearest darling Daisy deserves the best armour you can find for her. I don't care how much it costs, ask the dwarfs if you must, just get it done!"

effects.description: Armour: +15 for Marius when mounted on Daisy
Missile Block Chance: +20% for Marius when mounted on Daisy
Attribute: 360 missile defence for Marius when mounted on Daisy

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can block projectiles regardless of its facing.

skillTree.localised_description: "Oh, we'll make a soldier out of you yet, don't you worry. Now, grab that sword and show me what you can do!"

effects.description: Attribute: Immune to Psychology for Marius when mounted on Daisy

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description: Enables Dazed attacks for Marius when mounted on Daisy
Melee defence: +8 for Marius when mounted on Daisy

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.

effects.description: Leadership aura size: +25%
Passive ability: "Hold the Line!"

skillTree.localised_description: The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10%

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

skillTree.localised_description: A knight's worth no less than his steed, and Averland's horses are among the Old World's best.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +8 for Empire Knights, Knights of the Blazing Sun, and Reiksguard units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for all Empire Knights units (excluding Demigryph Knights)
	(Lord's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -15% for Empire Knights, Knights of the Blazing Sun, and Reiksguard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: While not that many outside of Averland would ever admit it, the rest of the Empire owns a lot to Averlanders and their Black Fire Pass defenders.

effects.description:
Attribute: Stalk for Pistoliers and Outriders
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

effects.description:
Missile damage: +12% for Pistoliers and Outriders
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 20% for Pistoliers and Outriders
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Leitdorf is notorious for wearing flamboyant clothing and for that he needs the best clothing materials available.

effects.description: Income from trade tariffs: +10%
Missile resistance: 10%
Diplomatic relations: +30 with Humans

skillTree.localised_description: Leitdorf is an exceptional swordsman and military tactician who leads his armies at the front with considerable flair and skill. In fact, a number of great victories are owed to his insane courage and uncanny insights, and Karl Franz counts Leitdorf amongst his most trusted allies.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15%
Bonus vs Infantry: +10
Character's aura leadership effect: +10

skillTree.localised_description: Not many men can be said to have waged wars against forests, swarms of bees and half-imagined fishmen. Marius Leitdorf is one of them though.

effects.description:
Enables flaming attacks when fighting against Wood Elves and Bretonnia
	(all characters)

Leadership: +8 when fighting against Wood Elves and Bretonnia
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs. Large: +8 when fighting against Wood Elves and Bretonnia
	(Lord's army)

Corruption: -3
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.

effects.description: Melee defence: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +15
Charge bonus: +30

skillTree.localised_description: Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.

effects.description: Armour: +7
Armour: +15

skillTree.localised_description: The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.

effects.description: Hit points: +7%
Hit points: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!

effects.description: Melee attack: +6
Melee attack: +12

skillTree.localised_description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

effects.description: Ability: "Foe-Seeker"

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10%
Weapon strength: +20%

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.

effects.description: Melee attack: +6
Melee attack: +12

skillTree.localised_description: The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.

effects.description: Leadership: +6

skillTree.localised_description: A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.

effects.description: Melee defence: +6

skillTree.localised_description: As an elected governing official of the Empire, an Elector Count has the power and authority to raise troops from his home province. In times of need, or if a regiment is being raised by the right individual, the Count may grant his favor to a unit.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

factionEffects.localised_description: Marius Leitdorf, known most infamously as the Mad Count of Averland, is the Elector Count of Averland and is counted as one of the Empire's bravest if not most sane Generals within the Empire's armed forces. Not many men can be said to have waged wars against forests, swarms of bees and half-imagined fishmen, so it is not without good reason that Marius Leitdorf is known as the Mad Count.

effects.description: Immune to Mountain attrition
Construction cost: -20% for resource-producing buildings
Melee defence: +5 when under siege

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Marius Leitdorf, known most infamously as the Mad Count of Averland or as he says it the Elector Count of Averland and is counted as one of the Empire's bravest if not most sane Generals within the Empire's armed forces.

effects.description: Immortal

Passive ability: "Knightly Charge" for Empire Knights, Knights of the Blazing Sun, and Reiksguard units
	(Lord's army)
Ability: "The Mad Count"

ui_effects.localised_text: Grants one of the listed effects at random

attributes.bullet_text: When this unit gets hurt it may go on a rampage against nearby enemy units, attacking the closest one and ignoring any orders given.
Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.
